page.title: 09THE SIKH TEMPLE.
page.content: The morning service begins with the Giranthi (reader) placing a piece of cloth on his head. He then goes into a room and places the Guru Granthi Sahib (the holy book) on the cloth. He walks over to a special area where he places the holy book and unwraps the cloth from it. He opens the book to the middle page and reads a paragraph and then turns to the first page. He reads five pages which shows the proper morning service. At the end of the service the servant brings the Karah Parshad (the sacred food) into the temple for all the people to eat. Once the service has finished people bow their heads and walk outside. By Herrinder Singh Tumber Gurdip Singh Tumber Ravinder Sandhu
